intro: Lagenandra wayambae, commonly known as the Wayamba lagenaria, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its unique, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It grows in rocky, dry habitats and is adapted to the specific environmental conditions of its native region. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
